definition[0]: to come to someone’s home or the place where they work in order to visit them
example[0]: I’ll come around later and see how you are.
example[1]: Why don’t you come round for lunch?
definition[1]: to change your opinion so that you now agree with someone or are no longer angry with them
example[2]: Don’t worry – she’ll come round eventually.
example[3]: It took him a while to come around to the idea.
definition[2]: if a regular event comes around, it happens as usual
example[4]: By the time the summer came around, Kelly was feeling much better.
definition[3]: to become conscious again after you have been unconscious
example[5]: When she came around her mother was sitting by her bed.
example[6]: You might feel a little sick when you come around from the anesthetic.
